docs.snippet: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 11 -- Taking advantage of the absence of Oscar Robertson from the line-up of the Milwaukee Bucks, the New York Knicks put on an impressive performance of balanced team basketball tonight to down the Bucks, the defending National Ba...
docs.lead_paragraph: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 11 -- Taking advantage of the absence of Oscar Robertson from the line-up of the Milwaukee Bucks, the New York Knicks put on an impressive performance of balanced team basketball tonight to down the Bucks, the defending National Basketball Association champions, 113-107, at Milwaukee arena.

headline.main: KNICKS SET BACK BUCKS BY 113-107; ROBERTSON RESTS; Abdul-Jabbar Scores 37, But Lucas Gets 29 and Lots of Help to Offset It KNICKS SET BACK BUCKS BY 113-107

byline.original: By THOMAS ROGERSSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The ghost of Floyd Patterson walked in Madison Square Garden last night, and the sad part of it was that the ghost won. Looking no more like a two-time champion of the world than one would expect of a 37-year-old in his 20th year as a professional...
docs.lead_paragraph: The ghost of Floyd Patterson walked in Madison Square Garden last night, and the sad part of it was that the ghost won. Looking no more like a two-time champion of the world than one would expect of a 37-year-old in his 20th year as a professional fist fighter, Patterson still had enough to win a unanimous decision in 10 rounds with rough, inept Oscar Bonavena.
docs.abstract: former world heavyweight boxing champ F Patterson defeats O Bonavena, NYC

headline.main: Patterson Gains Decision Over Bonavena at Garden; PATTERSON WINS GARDEN DECISION

docs.snippet: Floyd Patterson, the 37-year-old boxer who is the only man to hold the world heavyweight championship twice, will mark his 20th year of professional boxing fighting tonight in a bout with durable Oscar (Ringo) Bonavena of Argentina in Madison Squa...
docs.lead_paragraph: Floyd Patterson, the 37-year-old boxer who is the only man to hold the world heavyweight championship twice, will mark his 20th year of professional boxing fighting tonight in a bout with durable Oscar (Ringo) Bonavena of Argentina in Madison Square Garden.
docs.abstract: preparations for funeral service for father of former world heavyweight boxing champ F Patterson

headline.main: PATTERSON MARKS 20TH YEAR IN RING; Ex-Heavyweight Champion Will Meet Bonavena in Garden Bout Tonight

docs.snippet: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 10 -- Both the New York Knicks and the Milwaukee Bucks were concerned about injuries to star players today as they prepared for tomorrow night's National Basketball Association game at Milwaukee Arena....
docs.lead_paragraph: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 10 -- Both the New York Knicks and the Milwaukee Bucks were concerned about injuries to star players today as they prepared for tomorrow night's National Basketball Association game at Milwaukee Arena.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Since Oscar Shumsky has never really been away, it would be stretching a point to say that the violinist made a comeback at Tully Hall on Wednesday night, but his recital there was, in fact, the first he has given in New York since 1963, and nine ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Since Oscar Shumsky has never really been away, it would be stretching a point to say that the violinist made a comeback at Tully Hall on Wednesday night, but his recital there was, in fact, the first he has given in New York since 1963, and nine years is a long time.
docs.abstract: Shumsky, Oscar: Violinist O Shumsky concert revd by A Hughes

headline.main: Shumsky, Violinist, Plays Strongly in His Return

docs.snippet: LONDON, Feb. 8 -- Charles Chaplin said today he was not as angry with his American critics as he was reported to have been when he left the United States 20 years ago, vowing never to return....
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Feb. 8 -- Charles Chaplin said today he was not as angry with his American critics as he was reported to have been when he left the United States 20 years ago, vowing never to return.
docs.abstract: C Chaplin says he is not angry with his Amer critics as he was reptd to have been when he left US 20 yrs ago, vowing never to return, news conf, London, prior to opening of revival run of his films; says his pique over criticism of his pol and other subjects was exaggerated; says he eagerly looks forward to US visit in April when he will get special award at Acad Awards ceremony; says he is not sure he will be able to travel to Hollywood because of health; refuses to be quoted directly; press conf described; Chaplin's other comments noted; Chaplin films being shown in London listed

headline.main: CHAPLIN DISAVOWS ANY ANGER AT U.S.; Comedian Looking Forward to Trip Here in April

byline.original: By MICHAEL STERNSpecial to The New York Times
